<p>The <code>manimlib/mobject/svg/drawings.py</code> file defines a collection of SVG-based drawing classes used to create various visual objects in the Manim animation library. These objects include icons, symbols, and illustrative figures such as checkmarks, lightbulbs, speedometers, laptops, clocks, speech bubbles, and more. Each class encapsulates the geometric construction and styling of a specific drawing, facilitating their reuse in animations and scenes.</p>
<ul>
  <li><strong>Checkmark</strong>: Represents a checkmark symbol, typically used to indicate correctness or completion.</li>
  <li><strong>Exmark</strong>: Represents an exclamation mark, often used for warnings or emphasis.</li>
  <li><strong>Lightbulb</strong>: Visualizes a lightbulb icon, commonly used to symbolize ideas or insights.</li>
  <li><strong>Speedometer</strong>: Depicts a speedometer gauge, useful for illustrating speed or performance metrics.</li>
  <li><strong>Laptop</strong>: Constructs a stylized laptop with a screen, keyboard, and axis, allowing for visualizations of computers or technology concepts.</li>
  <li><strong>VideoIcon</strong>: Represents a video camera or media icon.</li>
  <li><strong>VideoSeries</strong>: Illustrates a series of video-related symbols or icons.</li>
  <li><strong>Clock</strong>: Creates a clock face, useful for time-related animations.</li>
  <li><strong>ClockPassesTime</strong>: An animated clock showing the passage of time.</li>
  <li><strong>Bubble</strong>: General speech or thought bubble for dialogue or thought representation.</li>
  <li><strong>SpeechBubble</strong>: A specific speech bubble shape for dialogue.</li>
  <li><strong>ThoughtBubble</strong>: A thought bubble shape, typically with smaller circles leading to a cloud-like shape.</li>
  <li><strong>OldSpeechBubble</strong>: A vintage or stylized speech bubble variant.</li>
  <li><strong>DoubleSpeechBubble</strong>: Two speech bubbles indicating conversation or multiple speakers.</li>
  <li><strong>OldThoughtBubble</strong>: An older style of thought bubble.</li>
  <li><strong>VectorizedEarth</strong>: An SVG representation of the Earth, suitable for geography or environment themes.</li>
  <li><strong>Piano</strong>: A visual depiction of a piano keyboard.</li>
  <li><strong>Piano3D</strong>: A three-dimensional representation of a piano.</li>
  <li><strong>DieFace</strong>: Represents a die face with a specific number of dots.</li>
  <li><strong>Dartboard</strong>: An SVG dartboard for games or target illustrations.</li>
</ul>
<p>Additionally, the file includes the <strong>Laptop</strong> class, which constructs a detailed laptop illustration with a body, screen, keyboard, and axis, allowing for dynamic positioning and styling within animations.</p>
